instructions: In each of the questions 1 to 5, fill in the blank space with a suitable word.

questions.question: _____ Opio buys new tyres for his car, he will not be arrested by traffic police officers.
questions.answer: If

questions.question: Most people enjoy _____ to radio talk shows.
questions.answer: listening

questions.question: That is the journalist to _____ we gave our articles to publish.
questions.answer: whom

questions.question: Lazy peeple _____ eating to working.
questions.answer: prefer

questions.question: A lion is _____ fierce than a leopard.
questions.answer: more

instructions: In each of the questions 6 to 15, use the correct form of the word given in the brackets to complete the sentence.

questions.question: The triplets opened the door by _____ .(them)
questions.answer: themselves

questions.question: My classmates behaved very _____ on our sports day. (good)
questions.answer: well

instructions: In each of the questions 16 to 17, drag and drop the given words in alphabetical order.
In each of the questions 18 to 20, give one word for the underlined group of words.

questions.question: Some of our classmates are <u>from Kenya</u>.
questions.answer: Kenyan

questions.question: Most birds make <u>homes of grass </u> in which to lay their eggs.
questions.answer: nests

questions.question: The lazy girl was <u> not successful </u> in the final examinations.
questions.answer: unsuccessful

instructions: In each of the questions 21 to 22, choose the sentence where the given word is used correctly.

questions.question: brake
options: I need to take a brake.
I need to brake for the stop sign.
He smashed the window and broke it.
I'm going to brake the law.
questions.answer: I need to brake for the stop sign.

questions.question: source
options: The library is an important sauce of knowledge.
We need to find a source to fix the car.
He likes to source the books at the bookstore.
The internet is a great source of information.
questions.answer: The internet is a great source of information.

instructions: In each of the questions 23 to 24, write the full form of the given abbreviation.

questions.question: it's
questions.answer: it is

questions.question: shan't
questions.answer: shall not

instructions: In each of the questions 25 to 26, drag and drop the given words to from a sentence.
In each of the questions 27 to 28, give the opposite of the underlined word(s) or given word.

questions.question: Lydia has gone to the bank to <u>withdraw</u> some money.
questions.answer: deposit

questions.question: Brenda walked <u>downstairs</u> to collect her clothes.
questions.answer: upstairs

instructions: In each of the questions 29 to 30, give the plural of the underlined or given word(s).

questions.question: Okello bought the new <u>badge</u> for Waya Nursery School uniforms.
questions.answer: badges

questions.question: potato
questions.answer: potatoes

instructions: In each of the questions 31 to 50, select the sentence with the correct rewritten option according to the instruction provided in the brackets.

questions.question: "Where has my aunt gone, Mary?" asked John. (Rewrite the sentence beginning: John asked.......)
options: John asked where has my aunt gone, Mary.
John asked Mary where his aunt had gone.
John asked Mary where my aunt has gone.
John asked where Mary has gone, his aunt.
questions.answer: John asked Mary where his aunt had gone.

questions.question: It is six year since I last travelled to Kampala. (Re-write the sentence  beginning: I last……………)
options: I last travelled to Kampala in six years.
I last travelled to Kampala six years ago.
questions.answer: I last travelled to Kampala six years ago.

questions.question: The tailor made a suit. The tailor also ironed a suit. (Re-write as on sentence beginning: Besides…………………)
options: Besides making a suit, the tailor also made it.
Besides making a suit, the tailor also ironed it.
questions.answer: Besides making a suit, the tailor also ironed it.

questions.question: Bbosa prefers posho to sweet potatoes. (Re-write  the sentence using:………………more…………)
options: Bbosa likes sweet potatoes more than posho.
Bbosa likes posho more than sweet potatoes.
questions.answer: Bbosa likes posho more than sweet potatoes.

questions.question: Who has broken my cup? (Rewrite the sentence using: By whom....)
options: By whom has my cup been broken?
By whom my cup has been broken?
By whom broken my cup?
By whom has broken my cup?
questions.answer: By whom has my cup been broken?

questions.question: What is the cost of a bull in your area? (Rewrite the sentence beginning: How…)
options: How is the cost of a bull in your area?
How much is the cost of a bull in your area?
How is the cost of a bull in your area?
How much a bull cost in your area?
questions.answer: How much is the cost of a bull in your area?

questions.question: Both Ichat and Bbosa are clever. (Re-write the sentence using………….as clever…………)
options: Ichat is as clever as Manja.
Ichat is not as clever as Manja.
questions.answer: Ichat is as clever as Manja.

questions.question: Our neighbor said that she had reported the case to police. (Re-write the sentence ending  “……………” said our neighbours.)
options: I reported the case to the police our neighbour said.
“I reported the case to the police,” said our neighbour.
questions.answer: “I reported the case to the police,” said our neighbour.

questions.question: The proposer say that water is better than fire. (Rewrite the sentence ending: ……………” the proposers say.)
options: “Fire is better than water.” the opposers say.
“Water is better than fire.” the proposers say.
“Fire is better than water.” the proposers say.
questions.answer: “Water is better than fire.” the proposers say.

questions.question: Eliana writes very well. Musa also writes very well. (Rewrite as one sentence using: .....and so .....)
options: Eliana writes very well and so Musa does too.
Eliana writes very well, and so does Musa.
Eliana writes very well, and so also Musa.
Eliana writes very well, and so is Musa.
questions.answer: Eliana writes very well, and so does Musa.

questions.question: The parents liked the drama. (Re-write the sentence using: …………interested………………)
options: The parents were not interested in the drama.
The parents were interested in the drama.
questions.answer: The parents were interested in the drama.

questions.question: All the children in our class speak English fluently. (Re-write the sentence using: Every……………)
options: Every child in my class speak English fluently.
Every children in my class speak English fluently.
questions.answer: Every child in my class speak English fluently.

questions.question: Hardly had the rains begun when we planted beans. (Rewrite the sentence beginning: No sooner….)
options: No sooner the rains had begun than we planted beans.
No sooner we planted beans than the rains had begun.
No sooner had the rains begun than we had planted beans.
No sooner had the rains begun than we planted beans.
questions.answer: No sooner had the rains begun than we planted beans.

questions.question: There is almost no water left in bucket. (Re-write the sentence using: ……………hardly…………)
options: There is hardly no water left in the bucket.
There is hardly any water left in the bucket.
questions.answer: There is hardly any water left in the bucket.

questions.question: That is the health centre. My little brother was born there. (Re-write as one sentence using: ………where……)
options: That is the health center where my little brother stays.
That is the health center where my little brother was born.
questions.answer: That is the health center where my little brother was born.

questions.question: Girls who leave school for early marriage usually get problems in future. Rewrite the sentence using …………often…………)
options: Girls who leave school for early marriage often get problems in future.
Girls who leave school for early marriage often don't get problems in future.
questions.answer: Girls who leave school for early marriage often get problems in future.

questions.question: Mukulo is carrying Ariho on a bicycle. (Rewrite the sentence beginning: Ariho.....)
options: Ariho is being carried by Mukulo on a bicycle.
Ariho is riding on a bicycle with Mukulo.
Ariho and Mukulo are cycling together.
Ariho is carrying Mukulo on a bicycle.
questions.answer: Ariho is being carried by Mukulo on a bicycle.

questions.question: Jeroma preferred sweat potatoes to cassava. (Re-write the sentence using: ……more……)
options: Jerome liked cassava more than sweet potatoes.
Jerome liked sweet potatoes more than cassava.
questions.answer: Jerome liked sweet potatoes more than cassava.

questions.question: Mark is very lazy. Mark cannot finish the work in time. (Re-write the sentence using: …………so…………that…………)
options: Mark is so lazy that he cannot finish the work on time.
Mark is so lazy that he can finish the work on time.
questions.answer: Mark is so lazy that he cannot finish the work on time.

questions.question: All children hate parents who are quarrelsome. (Rewrite the sentence beginning: Every child....)
options: Every child dislikes parents who are quarrelsome.
Every child loves parents who are quarrelsome.
Every child avoids parents who are quarrelsome.
Every child tolerates parents who are quarrelsome.
questions.answer: Every child dislikes parents who are quarrelsome.
